result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Authorization to appear received and filed.

1:31 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gerrica H D Baker in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Gerrica H D Baker.     Atty. Herbers provides an update; he is still waiting on an offer.  State has an offer and will provide it to Defense.  Atty. Herbers requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
